Data Scientist / AI Engineer (m/f/d)
HMS Analytical Software GmbH
slide number 1
About Us

Our over 30-year success story in the software analytics sector shows: we are highly specialized experts when it comes to creating data-driven business models. Through the synthesis of data engineering, machine learning, and software engineering, we support companies in generating added value from their data. Our over 160 employees drive digital modernization in the manufacturing, finance, and life science industries and pave the way for an economy based on knowledge, technology, and responsibility.
Your Responsibilities

    As a Data Scientist / AI Engineer (m/f/d), you will work with our clients to develop innovative solutions for challenging data analysis using machine learning and GenAI.
    You will develop exploratory analyses and models to optimize business processes and integrate them into our clients' system landscape.
    You will conduct challenging consulting and development projects that profitably combine analytics, data engineering, and computer science.
    You will actively participate in the digitalization of business processes and production facilities through artificial intelligence at leading companies.

Your Qualifications

    At least a good degree in computer science, business informatics, or related fields, or in mathematics, physics, or comparable scientific studies
    Initial practical experience in applying software engineering principles and in DevOps/MLOps principles and tools
    Knowledge of at least one analytical programming language (e.g., Python, R) or a general-purpose programming language (e.g., C#, Java, C++, Rust)
    Knowledge of using relational and non-relational databases
    Excellent communication skills in German and English - in the team and with clients
    Curiosity and willingness to travel occasionally

Advantageous:

    Professional experience in software engineering, data science, or business intelligence, or as a consultant in the digitalization context
    Experience with cloud technologies (e.g., Azure, AWS), big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Kafka), and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)

We offer all the framework conditions to efficiently work into these topics, if you do not bring this knowledge with you.
What We Offer
People & Culture: The community and exchange within the company are actively promoted through various events such as company lunches, summer parties, team events, company conferences, and Christmas parties. A welcome day and a mentoring program during the onboarding period also help to strengthen cohesion within the teams. In addition, we foster team spirit through a substantial profit-sharing scheme distributed to all employees.

Career Development & Knowledge Exchange: The variety of our (client) projects enables individual career development. A wide range of training courses and participation in specialist conferences promote professional growth. An annual knowledge budget of 12 days and knowledge circles support continuous knowledge exchange.

Work-Life Balance & Flexibility: Flexible working hours with a working time account, mobile office/hybrid working, workation/sabbatical options, and the possibility of bringing dogs to the office are just part of our offer for flexibility and quality of life. We also support you in critical situations with up to 5 paid days off to care for dependent or sick family members.

Financial Benefits: Employees benefit from our subsidies for: childcare, food and sports, company pension scheme with non-binding advice, Germany ticket for sustainable travel.

Health & Well-being: Various health measures such as active breaks, ergonomics advice, flu vaccinations, and eye examinations promote the well-being and long-term health of employees. Healthy snacks and drinks are, of course, also part of our offer. And to strengthen social interaction, we have established hobby and sports groups, which not only strengthen casual exchange but also team cohesion.

Social Responsibility & Sustainability: Through the HuManS Foundation, we strive to make a positive contribution to society. Our climate initiative and environmental program are committed to sustainable business practices.
We look forward to receiving your online application as a Data Scientist (m/f/d) in full-time or part-time employment (at least 80%)!
Apply Now

Your Contact Persons:
